01.description: The office is located near South Park in San Francisco.   There's a nice front entrance, but Dean prefers the back alley.

02.description: Our office is the 2nd floor of the white building.

03.description: Monday:  Giles and Ed made sure that there were desks, computers and a network when people walked in the door.   Too bad there weren't chairs, but work got done anyway.

04.description: Our neighbors across the way are marine metalworkers.   We think they build toilets for submarines.

05.description: The neighbor directly across has some business that requires lots of dumpsters and white pickup trucks.

06.description: The other end of our alley:  the Grand Filipino Temple of San Francisco.

07.description: George (leaning) and Grant (sitting) focus with laser intensity as workmen install what seems to be a helicopter pad on our roof.

08.description: Our crapper has the most beautiful natural light.  Really.

10.description: Chairs are delivered.  Chairs are assembled.   That black ball is called the Evolution Chair.  Evolutionary dead end, maybe:  only Dean and Giles like it.

11.description: Starting to look like a place of business.

12.description: For a few days our lack of whiteboards was crippling.   How can you create software without whiteboards?  These became our interim solution, before the massive ones were delivered.

13.description: Seeing as our alley door had already been visited by artists, Dean added his own personal touch.

description:
Dean's company (finally) got the keys to their office last Thursday (May 25th). That weekend Ed and Giles did superhero work running ethernet cable and setting up desks delivered from IKEA.

Monday was a holiday. Tuesday morning everybody began putting together computers and office stuff. Chairs arrived in the afternoon. Throughout the day people were actually trying to build software, too.

Office equipment rolled in all week: phones, printers, a stereo. Cleaning service, garbage service, bottled water service were all arranged. Construction workers popped in and out to fix ceilings, doors, and more.

To cap off the week, Friday night after a few beers Dean and Giles installed some massive 4'x8' whiteboards using special glue and screws. They almost look like someone sober was wielding the power tools.

What does the company do? We'll be letting the world know soon!

Return to rest of the week of June 4th.
title: June 4
